name: Campaign Monitor
description: Campaign Monitor makes it easy for you to create, send, and optimize your email marketing campaigns.

configuration.name: List IDs
configuration.description: For configurations with events enabled. Please enter a comma separated list of the ids of list you want to watch for events.

configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)
configuration.description: Campaign Monitor Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: OAuth Token Refresh URL
configuration.description: Campaign Monitor OAuth Token Refresh URL

configuration.name: Authentication Type
configuration.description: Authentication using  API Key select 'basic' and for Oauth2 select 'oauth2'

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

resources.description: List all the accounts in your account, including their name and ID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

resources.description: Create an account

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The account object to be created.

resources.description: Delete an account

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: id of account to delete. Client ID from the get /accounts endpoint.

resources.description: Retrieve an account

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to retrieve from the Marketing Automation system.

resources.description: Retrieve an account associated with a given ID.  Endpoint is used to retrieve account details after POST /accounts.
Search for activities for the campaign based on activity type

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 100 if not supplied

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The following  where clause is required: activityType = '' and campaignId = ''.Possible values for activityType: bounces, clicks, unsubscribes, opens. The following fields are optional in the where clause.   date: Will retrieve all activities past date use format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM.  orderfield: field to order activities by. Possible values: email, list, date.  orderdirection: direction to order the returned activities. Possible values :asc or dec.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

resources.description: List all the accounts in your account, including their name and ID
Search for campaigns based on status

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The following where clause is required: status ='' and id = ''. Possible values for status:  sent, scheduled, draft.  Where id is the ClientID returned from the /accounts endpoint.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

resources.description: Create a campaign. Note that you may optionally specify a TextUrl field in your input if you want to specify text content for the campaign. If you dont specify TextUrl or if TextUrl is left empty, the text content for the campaign will be automatically generated from the HTML content. Either SegmentIds or ListIDs are required

parameters.name: campaign
parameters.description: campaign

parameters.name: ClientID
parameters.description: CientID from the accounts endpoint

resources.description: Delete a campaign

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: CampaignID returned from the /campaigns endpoint.

resources.description: Retrieve a campaign, returns basic summary of the results for any sent campaign such as the number of recipients, opens, clicks, unsubscribes, etc to date. Also includes the web version URL, and the public Worldview URL for the campaign

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to retrieve from Campaign Monitor.

resources.description: Retrieve an campaign associated with a given ID.  Endpoint is used to retrieve account details after POST /campaigns.

hooks.body:
var body = response_body
var id = request_previous_response.id
body.CampaignID = id
done ({
"continue": true, 
"response_body": body 
})

resources.description: List all contacts for a list

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The following where clause is required: status = ''. Possible value for status:  active, unconfirmed, unsubscribed, bounced, deleted. The following fields are optional in the where clause date: Will return subscribers which became active after the Date value specified will be returned. Must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. If not provided.  orderfield: The field which should be used to order the results. Possible values: date  email, name, date. orderdirection: field to order activities by. Possible values: asc or desc.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: ListID returned from the GET /lists endpoint.
